node.title: Four children die in house fire in Melbourne's south-west
node.alt: Firefighters illuminated by emergency blue and red lights stand outside a home billowing smoke.
node.description: Arson squad detectives are investigating the cause of the blaze in Werribee, which left three people in hospital and four children dead.
node.content:
["Four children have died in a fire that tore through a house in south-west Melbourne.", "Police said investigators were told the fire started at the house on Mantello Drive in Werribee shortly after 1:00am.", "Thick black smoke was seen pouring from the brick home.", "The four children were all unaccounted for early on Sunday morning.", "Police have now confirmed the two boys and two girls could not be saved in the blaze.", "The 10-year-old and three-year-old boys and six-year-old and one-year-old girls were found deceased inside the home.", "It took about 40 firefighters just under an hour to bring the fire under control.", "", "
A large emergency services presence at the scene of the fire.(ABC News)
", "A man, a woman and their eight-year old child were taken to hospital with smoke-related injuries.", "The Victoria Police arson squad is now trying to piece together what caused the blaze.\u00a0Police are unable to say whether it is being treated as suspicious at this stage.", "Specialist fire investigators from the Country Fire Authority and Fire Rescue Victoria are working with arson squad detectives on the investigation.", "Counselling is being provided to the emergency crews who were on the scene."]
